page.title: 14MEADOW ECOLOGY SURVEY 1985
page.content: A meadow was studied in Mylor. Grasses and flowers were identified.A quadrant was thrown at random and the contents were recorded.The commonest plants were grass and clover.There were numerous species of grasses.There was no litter at all but a small amount of cow dung. Animal life was sparse with only a few grasshoppers and small flies.Other plants present were thistles, dandelions, daisies and plantain. The meadow was on a steep slope facing the water .The meadow was overgrown with thistles and nettles near the hedgerows, with a few trees. Nearby ,was a disused quarry, where the following species were found, Rosebay Willow herb, Foxglove, brambles, stitchwort,Convolvulus,Old mans beard and birds foot trefoil.
